00075 unsigned int
00076 I_BDD_num_terms (DdManager * dd)
00077 {
00078   return dd->size;
00079 }
00080 
00081 static void
00082 I_BDD_minterms_aux (DdManager * dd, DdNode * node, char *list,
00083                     List * minterm_list)
00084 {
00085   DdNode *N, *Nv, *Nnv;
00086   int i, index;
00087   char *new_list;
00088 
00089   N = Cudd_Regular (node);
00090 
00091   if (cuddIsConstant (N))
00092     {
00093       /* Terminal case: Print one cube based on the current recursion
00094          ** path, unless we have reached the background value (ADDs) or
00095          ** the logical zero (BDDs).
00096        */
00097       if (node != dd->background && node != Cudd_Not (dd->one))
00098         {
00099           if (!(new_list = (char *) malloc (sizeof (char) * dd->size)))
00100             I_punt ("I_BDD_minterms_aux: cannot allocate array");
00101 
00102           for (i = 0; i < dd->size; i++)
00103             new_list[i] = list[i];
00104 
00105           if (cuddV (node) != 1)
00106             I_punt ("I_BDD_minterms_aux: bad BDD");
00107 
00108           *minterm_list = List_insert_last (*minterm_list, new_list);
00109         }
00110     }
00111   else
00112     {
00113       Nv = cuddT (N);
00114       Nnv = cuddE (N);
00115       if (Cudd_IsComplement (node))
00116         {
00117           Nv = Cudd_Not (Nv);
00118           Nnv = Cudd_Not (Nnv);
00119         }
00120       index = N->index;
00121       list[index] = 0;
00122       I_BDD_minterms_aux (dd, Nnv, list, minterm_list);
00123       list[index] = 1;
00124       I_BDD_minterms_aux (dd, Nv, list, minterm_list);
00125       list[index] = 2;
00126     }
00127 
00128   return;
00129 }
00130 
00131 
00132 List
00133 I_BDD_minterms (DdManager * dd, DdNode * node)
00134 {
00135   int i;
00136   List minterm_list;
00137   char *list;
00138 
00139   list = (char *) malloc (sizeof (char) * dd->size);
00140 
00141   if (list == NULL)
00142     I_punt ("I_BDD_minterms_aux: cannot allocate array");
00143 
00144   for (i = 0; i < dd->size; i++)
00145     list[i] = 2;
00146 
00147   minterm_list = NULL;
00148   I_BDD_minterms_aux (dd, node, list, &minterm_list);
00149 
00150   free (list);
00151 
00152   return (minterm_list);
00153 }
00154 
00155 void
00156 I_BDD_print_minterm (char *m, int n)
00157 {
00158   unsigned int i;
00159 
00160   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00161     if (m[i] > 1)
00162       fprintf (stderr, "-");
00163     else
00164       fprintf (stderr, "%d", m[i]);
00165 }
00166 
00167 void
00168 I_BDD_print_minterms (List mins, int terms)
00169 {
00170   char *minterm;
00171   int indx;
00172 
00173   List_start (mins);
00174   while ((minterm = (char *) List_next (mins)))
00175     {
00176       for (indx = 0; indx < terms; indx++)
00177         {
00178           if (minterm[indx] == 2)
00179             printf ("-");
00180           else
00181             printf ("%d", (int) minterm[indx]);
00182         }
00183       printf ("\n");
00184     }
00185 }
00186 
00187 #undef I_BDD_MUTEX_TEST
00188 #undef I_BDD_MUTEX_DEBUG
00189 
00190 /*
00191  * void
00192  * I_BDD_new_mutex_domain (DdManager *dd, DdNode *node[], unsigned int size)
00193  * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00194  * JWS 20010406
00195  * Create a new finite domain of size "size", filling the (preallocated)
00196  * buffer "node" with pointers to the included nodes.  Each node has a 
00197  * reference count of one on return.
00198  *
00199  * A finite domain of size N is a set of N mutually exclusive, collectively
00200  * exhaustive nodes.
00201  */
00202 
00203 void
00204 I_BDD_new_mutex_domain (DdManager *dd, DdNode *node[], unsigned int size)
00205 {
00206   unsigned int shbuf, vars, ctr;
00207   DdNode **ddVar, *one, *newnode, *oldnode, *bitnode;
00208   int i,j, extra;
00209 
00210   /* base cases */
00211 
00212   if (size == 0)
00213     {
00214       return;
00215     }
00216 
00217   one = Cudd_ReadOne(dd);
00218 
00219   if (size == 1)
00220     {
00221       node[0] = one;
00222       Cudd_Ref (node[0]);
00223       return;
00224     }
00225 
00226   for(shbuf = size - 1, vars = 0; shbuf != 0; shbuf >>= 1, vars++);
00227 
00228   extra = (1 << vars) - size;
00229 
00230   ddVar = malloc(vars * sizeof(DdNode *));
00231 
00232   for (j = 0; j < vars; j++)
00233     {
00234       ddVar[j] = bitnode = Cudd_bddNewVar (dd);
00235       Cudd_Ref (bitnode);
00236     }
00237 
00238   ctr = 0;
00239 
00240   for (i = 0; i < size; i++, ctr++)
00241     {
00242       newnode = one;
00243       Cudd_Ref (newnode);
00244 
00245 #ifdef I_BDD_MUTEX_DEBUG
00246       printf("i%d:", i);
00247 #endif
00248 
00249       for (j = (extra > 0); j < vars; j++)
00250         {
00251           bitnode = (ctr & (1 << j)) ? ddVar[j] : Cudd_Not(ddVar[j]);
00252 
00253           newnode = Cudd_bddAnd (dd, bitnode, oldnode = newnode);
00254           Cudd_Ref (newnode);
00255           Cudd_RecursiveDeref (dd, oldnode);
00256 
00257 #ifdef I_BDD_MUTEX_DEBUG
00258           if (ctr & (1 << j))
00259             printf("+ v%d ", j);
00260           else
00261             printf("+ !v%d ", j);
00262 #endif
00263         }
00264 
00265 #ifdef I_BDD_MUTEX_DEBUG
00266       printf ("\n");
00267 #endif
00268 
00269       node[i] = newnode;
00270 
00271       if (extra > 0)
00272         {
00273           extra--;
00274           ctr++;
00275         }
00276     }
00277 
00278 #ifdef I_BDD_MUTEX_TEST
00279   {
00280     DdNode *test, *old_test;
00281     int i;
00282     test = Cudd_ReadLogicZero(dd);
00283     Cudd_Ref (test);
00284     for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
00285       {
00286         if (Cudd_bddIte (dd, test, node[i], zero) != zero)
00287           I_punt("I_BDD_new_mutex_complex: not mutex!");
00288 
00289         test = Cudd_bddIte(dd, node[i], one, old_test = test);
00290         Cudd_Ref (test);
00291         Cudd_RecursiveDeref (dd, old_test);
00292       }
00293     if (test != one)
00294       I_punt("I_BDD_new_mutex_complex: not exhaustive!");
00295 
00296     Cudd_RecursiveDeref (dd, test);
00297     }
00298 #endif
00299 
00300   for (j = 0; j < vars; j++)
00301     Cudd_RecursiveDeref (dd, ddVar[j]);
00302 
00303   free (ddVar);
00304   return;
00305 }
